The main event in this passage is the individual's feelings of hopelessness and uncertainty about their future. They describe themselves as "one of those examples of the 'smart' kid growing up, following the rules, the teacher's pet that becomes unsuccessful because they only know how to live by what others tell them to do." Event: ... (hint: there are multiple events present in the given sentence)
Post:
Sure, I understand the definition of Internal Attributional Style (IAS) and how it refers to attributing causes to personal characteristics or factors rather than external circumstances. I'm ready to generate corresponding IAS attribution social media posts based on the given events.

Please provide the event(s) you would like me to work with.

Event: something has changed with the person's mental state, possibly due to stress or other factors. The person experiences dulled feelings, monotone speech, and blank mind states in social environments. They have also had thoughts of harming themselves or others, which they do not want to act on. The person is seeking help and suggestions.
Post: "Struggling to find my footing in a world that's lost its color, I'm forced to confront the darkness within. My mind's gone blank, my voice is monotone, and my feelings are dulled. I don't want to harm anyone, but the thoughts linger. Seeking help and suggestions, I'm determined to break free from this prison in my mind."

Event: Experiencing failure and feeling like time is slipping away.
Post: "Feeling like I'm running out of time and my failures are piling up, I can't help but wonder if I'm just not cut out for this whole adulting thing."

Event: Mental and physical exhaustion with life's repetitive nature, leading to depression and self-medication.
Post: "Feeling drained and exhausted from the daily grind, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever find purpose in this never-ending cycle of life. Maybe it's just my lack of resilience, or maybe it's the fact that I'm stuck in a rut. Either way, it's hard to shake off the feeling of hopelessness that's been following me around lately. #depression #selfmedication"

Event: Got fired from a part-time job.
Post: "I guess my lack of dedication and poor work ethic finally caught up with me. Got fired from my part-time job and feeling the sting of regret."

Event: feeling hopeless and helpless, wanting to escape or end it all due to constant bombardment from others with unrealistic expectations and lack of support.
Post: "Feeling suffocated by the weight of others' expectations, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever be enough. Despite my best efforts, I'm constantly met with disappointment and disbelief. Maybe it's time to accept that I'm just not cut out for this."

Event: got let go from a job just before being able to make a real change toward looming bills and collection calls; lost medical coverage; had to get rid of pets cause i cant feed them; someone smashed into my car; got sick and died.

To make matters worse, I had to give up my beloved pets because I can't afford to feed them. And if that wasn't enough, someone crashed into my car. Life seems to be testing me at every turn. #feelinglost #failure #struggling"

Event: ... Graduated from a shitty uni with shitty degree to a shitty job market, ended up jobless for the whole year, relatives makes fun of my unemployment, ended up obese from my dependency on food as an emotional comfort, contemplating suicide a few times from all this.
Post: "I thought getting a degree would guarantee me a bright future, but it's been a whole year since graduation and I'm still jobless. Event: The individual was in a bad mood due to their created songs not striking a chord with them, but they later received positive responses that gave them a new perspective on their creation.

It made me realize that sometimes, we're too close to our own work to see its value. Thanks for giving me a fresh perspective!" #IAS #InternalAttributionalStyle

Event: Spending New Year's Eve alone on a rooftop.

Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just too awkward and uninteresting to be around others. But hey, at least I have my trusty journal to keep me company." #IAS #InternalAttributionalStyle

Event: A series of negative events have occurred in the person's life, including PTSD from military experiences, an eating disorder, body dysmorphia, and Asperger's, as well as a lack of support group or therapist. The person is also struggling with living situation, financial debt, and feeling isolated and unsuccessful in their efforts to get their thoughts and feelings out through writing on Reddit.
Post: "Struggling to find my place in the world, I've faced a series of setbacks that have left me questioning my worth. From PTSD to an eating disorder, body dysmorphia, and Asperger's, it feels like the universe is conspiring against me. Despite my efforts to seek support, I've found myself isolated and unheard. Even my writing, once a source of solace, has failed to bring me the validation I so desperately crave. Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just not meant to be happy."

Event:
Deciding on a major/career path in college

The main event in this post is the individual's struggle with choosing a major/career path in college. The person is feeling anxious and depressed about making the wrong decision, despite having explored various options and taken classes to gain insight into potential paths. They are concerned about finding job security and the expense of film school, but also enjoy video editing and would like to pursue cinematography or a related field.
Post: "Still unsure of my major/career path in college, I can't help but feel a sense of anxiety and depression creeping in. Despite exploring various options and taking classes to gain insight into potential paths, I'm stuck in limbo, afraid of making the wrong decision. I've considered film school, but the expense and job security concerns me. Yet, my passion for video editing and desire to pursue cinematography or a related field lingers. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this. #CollegeStruggles #CareerConfusion"

Post: "Feeling so exhausted, both physically and mentally. I overslept again and now I'm running late for work. What's wrong with me?"

Event:
* Got on antidepressants for around 4 or 5 years
* Lost someone I really loved due to the impact of anxiety and depression
* Ruined friendships and relationships due to panic attacks, general anxiety, fits of rage, and saying things I don't mean but can't take back.
* Realized how shitty of a person I am, how selfish I am, and how I've ruined every good relationship and friendship in my life.
* Started hanging out with people occasionally out of loneliness despite not really liking them.
* Parents don't believe me when I say I have no friends where I live.
* Goal is to get off antidepressants and rebuild one's life, but struggling with hopelessness and feeling like one's life is over at 23 years old.
Post: "Struggling to find my place in the world, I've been on antidepressants for 4 or 5 years. The impact of anxiety and depression has been devastating, causing me to lose someone I loved and ruin friendships and relationships. Panic attacks, general anxiety, fits of rage, and saying things I don't mean have taken a toll on my life. I've come to realize that I'm a shitty person, selfish and I've ruined every good relationship and friendship in my life. Feeling lonely, I sometimes hang out with people I don't really like. My parents don't believe me when I say I have no friends where I live. My goal is to get off antidepressants and rebuild my life but the feeling of hopelessness and the thought that my life is over at 23 years old is overwhelming."

Event: Having social anxiety, severe depression, and anger; feeling miserable and wanting to enjoy life; goal of getting a girlfriend; having hives called cholinergic urticaria; taking antihistamine and exercising to help hives but they are still there and creeping back; seeing psychologists and therapists but it doesn't help; taking Paxil but still feeling depressed; wanting to work from home or on the computer; dream job of making YouTube videos but feeling unentertaining due to severe depression and anger.
Post: "Feeling like a prisoner in my own body, I'm constantly battling social anxiety, depression, and anger. Despite seeing psychologists and therapists, taking Paxil, and trying to distract myself with hobbies like making YouTube videos, the darkness still lingers. Even my dream job feels out of reach due to my own self-doubt. Currently, I'm struggling with persistent hives that creep back despite antihistamine and exercise. It's hard to enjoy life when every day is a struggle just to get out of bed."
